media:group.media:title: Q&A with A&V Livestream 11/9/22 8:00 PM
media:group.media:description:
Virologists Amy Rosenfeld and Vincent Racaniello answer your questions about viruses - including SARS-CoV-2, monkeypox virus, poliovirus, influenza virus, and more - on this livestream on Wednesday 11/9/22 at 8:00 PM eastern US.
Become a patron of Q&A at microbe.tv/contribute

entry.title: TWiP 210: Is there a doctor on board? with Aisha Khatib

media:group.media:title: TWiP 210: Is there a doctor on board? with Aisha Khatib
media:group.media:description:
From ASTMH2022 in Seattle, Aisha joins the TWiP team to talk about her training and her career, including delivering a baby on an airplane, and they solve the Case of the Heartsick Guatemalan Septuagenarian.
Show notes at https://www.microbe.tv/twip/twip-210/
Become a patron of TWiP at microbe.tv/contribute

entry.title: TWiV 950: Prion diseases with Richard Knight

media:group.media:title: TWiV 950: Prion diseases with Richard Knight
media:group.media:description:
From the European Society for Clinical Virology 2022 Conference in Manchester UK, Vincent speaks with Richard Knight aboutÂ prion diseases and the outbreak of bovine spongiform encephalitis that led to cases of variant Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease in humans.
Show notes at https://www.microbe.tv/twiv/twiv-950/

entry.title: TWiV 949: Clinical update with Dr. Daniel Griffin

media:group.media:title: TWiV 949: Clinical update with Dr. Daniel Griffin
media:group.media:description:
In his weekly clinical update Dr. Griffin discusses progress toward poliomyelitis eradication in Pakistan, polio by the numbers , influenza and COVID-19 vaccination coverage among health care personnel, phase 1/2a safety and immunogenicity of an adenovirus 26 vector RSV vaccine encoding prefusion F in adults 18â€“50 years and RSV seropositive children 12â€“24 months, receipt of first and second doses of JYNNEOS vaccine for prevention of Monkeypox, distinguishing SARS-CoV-2 persistence and reinfection, Novavax NVX-COV2373 triggers potent neutralization of Omicron sub-lineages, association between regular physical activity and the protective effect of vaccination against SARS-CoV-2 in a South African case, COVID-19 outcomes in solid organ transplant recipients who received Tixagevimab-cilgavimab Prophylaxis and/or Bebtelovimab treatment, Omicron sublineage BA.2.75.2 exhibits extensive escape from neutralizing antibodies, and Tocilizumab versus Baricitinib in hospitalized patients with severe COVID-19.
Show notes at https://www.microbe.tv/twiv/twiv-949/
Become a patron of TWiV at microbe.tv/contribute

entry.title: TWiV 947: Clinical update with Dr. Daniel Griffin

media:group.media:title: TWiV 947: Clinical update with Dr. Daniel Griffin
media:group.media:description:
In his weekly clinical update Dr. Griffin discusses theÂ prediction of upcoming global infection burden of influenza seasons after relaxation of public health and social measures during the COVID-19 pandemic, severe COVID-19 outcomes after full vaccination of primary schedule and initial boosters, and howÂ successful immunomodulators for treatment of COVID-19 have opened the pathway for comparative trials.
Show notes at https://www.microbe.tv/twiv/twiv-947/
Become a patron of TWiV at microbe.tv/contribute

entry.title: TWiM 274: Bacterial endosymbionts block giant viruses

media:group.media:title: TWiM 274: Bacterial endosymbionts block giant viruses
media:group.media:description:
Mark Martin returns to TWiM to join the discussion of how to design a complex gut microbiome, and protection of protists from virus infection by intracellular bacterial symbionts.

media:group.media:title: TWiV 946: Poo versus flu
media:group.media:description:
Angela Mingarelli joins TWiV to discuss whether the gut microbiota of bats confers tolerance to influenza virus infection in mice, and primate hemorrhagic fever-causing arteriviruses that can reproduce in human cells and might be capable of infecting humans.

entry.title: TWiV 945: Clinical update with Dr. Daniel Griffin

media:group.media:title: TWiV 945: Clinical update with Dr. Daniel Griffin
media:group.media:description:
In his weekly clinical update Dr. Griffin discussesÂ a healthcare-associated infection with Monkeypox virus,Â air and surface sampling for monkeypox virus in a UK hospital,Â misrepresentation and nonadherence regarding COVID19 public health measures,Â tolerability and immunogenicity of an intranasally-administered adenovirus-vectored COVID-19 vaccine,Â clinical, virologic, and immunologic evaluation of symptomatic rebound following Nirmatrelvir/Ritonavir treatment,Â early outpatient treatment with Eemdesivir in patients at high risk for severe COVID-19,Â Molnupiravir plus usual care versus usual care alone as early treatment for adults with COVID-19 at increased risk of adverse outcomes, and outcomes among confirmed cases and a matched comparison group in the long-COVID in Scotland.
Show notes at https://www.microbe.tv/twiv/twiv-945/
Become a patron of TWiV at microbe.tv/contribute
